attributes.additional_details: It is the Job of the  UK Government to keep the British public safe and this  Government are not doing this when allowing this number of Illegals to enter the UK using boats to cross the channel Unchallenged and unchecked. This government said that they would address this problem and stop or make it harder for theses people to come across the channel and have failed to do so . This petition is let the Government know  that the British public  are angry and want this Government to take a harder line and stop theses illegal crossings now .
attributes.background: This petition is about stopping the Illegal entry in to the UK of immigrants crossing the channel in boats . Over 20,000 have now made this journey in the last year alone and this can not and should not be aloud to continue and this Government must listen to British public and stop this .

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about illegal attempts to enter the UK, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Revoke UK-France agreement to tackle illegal immigration: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593478
